intro: Heliophila stenocarpa, commonly known as narrow-fruited heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Heliophila stenocarpa is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
